climbs.name: Mirabilis
climbs.fa: Shingo Ohkinawa, Andy Ross, Gene Vallee

content.description:
Pitch 1: 5.6 scramble on shit rock

Pitch 2: Thin crack gets you started, make some sporty moves while placing small gear. 3 bolts traverse right and over the bugle too yet another thin crack, power through a thin crack lyback up to the chains
content.location: At the head of the gully between the "Gargoyle" and "Intensive Care" Buttresses.

climbs.name: Gargoyle
climbs.fa: FA: Mark Ward & JimKnight 1976.  FFA: Bobby Rotert 1983

content.description: One of LCC's best.  Killer thin crack liebacking.  The crux is placing gear.  The second pitch rounds the ear and goes up and past the horn with the slings.  Climbing through to the horn in one pitch gives the most continuous climbing and goes to an obvious stance, but requires a 70m rope and the rock just past the original anchor spot is a bit grotty.  I've never climbed past the horn, reportedly the rock of the second pitch is of less quality than the first pitch.
content.protection:
One piton, which still looks fairly solid.  The second piton was removed 10/11/07 because it was cracked and redundant, clean pro is found above and below.  There are several good nut placements, bring multiples of small TCUs, and hand sizes for the handcrack.  Placing gear is the crux for most.  The two-bolt anchor with tattered nylon was revised 10/11/07.  The 1/4" X 1" bolt was rusted and removed with almost no effort.  It was replaced with a 3/8" X 3.5" bolt with a stainless ring anchor.  The other bolt looks OK and should be safe, it has a biner with rap ring on it.  Thirty feet of unsightly tattered nylon was removed.

For a more continuous pitch, climb past the anchors, around the ear, to the obvious stance under the horn with the slings and biners.  Lowering from here requires a 70m.
content.location: Obvious perfect shallow dihedral on east-facing wall across from the base of Intensive Care.  One can rap the first pitch with a 60m rope, be careful with anything shorter.  Continuing on would require two ropes for the rappel.

content.description: This is the chimney/offwidth system to the right of the classic Gargoyle pitch.  This route is really fun.  Start with steps and edges, then enjoy the double cracks.  Arm Bars with the left and finger locks and jams with the right.  Climb to an ancient bolt then the business begins. Either stuff yourself through the super tight squeeze chimney straight up (5.9), or go out the bulge via the offwidth (5.11).End the pitch at a belay with one good and one brand new bolt. Eat your Wheaties for the Offwidth or don't eat anything for two days for the Squeeze.
content.protection: One single set of Cams, at least one monster cam #6 Camalot or equivalent.  Double on the monster cams would be nice but are not mandatory.  Slings and quickdraws.  Stopper are not needed.
content.location: High up the Fin Gully on the Gargoyle Wall. Look for the only wide system with a wide roof/bulge section about 75' up.

climbs.name: Big Neon Glitter
climbs.fa: FA: John Storm, Douglas Heinrich, Conrad Anker 1988

content.description: An LCC classic that graced the cover of the first Ruckman guide. Its hard to overstate how cutting edge this was in 1988.  Pretty damn hard pulling the crux, but its not over until you climb the prow above.  You get extra points on your 8a.nu scorecard if you send it in a pink tank top.
content.protection: After clipping the lowest bolt, throw in some TCUs in the flake to protect the hand traverse.  Bolts protect the remainder of the climbing.
content.location: Located on the obvious steep prow left of Gargoyle.

climbs.name: Angry Elf on a Shelf
climbs.fa: Powerful Jim, Hitman, Rossy, and Guitar Czar
